meanings.definition: Guilty of a moral offense; sinning
meanings.sent1: The peccant man regretted his actions deeply.
meanings.sent2: She knew she had been peccant, but sought forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The peccant puppy chewed up all the shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: His peccant behavior cast a shadow over his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The peccant deed haunted him like a ghost in the night.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to sin; morally corrupt
meanings.sent1: The peccant nature of the criminal was evident in his actions.
meanings.sent2: The peccant politician's scandals were well-known.
meanings.sent3: Even the most peccant characters in the story found redemption.
meanings.sent4: The peccant influence of the group led to chaos.
meanings.sent5: Her peccant thoughts whispered temptations in her ear.
